Posts.Content: KasSha wrote: After four years of mets contained to my bones, it has now shown up in my liver....8 tumors. I am scheduled for chemoembilization this Friday the 9th.  Anyone ever have this procedure? Any info would be helpful. Radiation Therapy 4/30/1995 Breast, Bone Dx 10/1995, DCIS, 3cm, Stage IV, 7/14 nodes, mets, ER+/PR-, HER2+ Chemotherapy 10/31/1995 Abraxane (albumin-bound or nab-paclitaxel), Adriamycin (doxorubicin), Carboplatin (Paraplatin), Cytoxan (cyclophosphamide), Fluorouracil (5-fluorouracil, 5-FU, Adrucil), Gemzar (gemcitabine), Ixempra (ixabepilone), Navelbine (vinorelbine), Taxol (paclitaxel), Taxotere (docetaxel), Xeloda (capecitabine) Radiation Therapy 10/31/2007 Bone Targeted Therapy 1/22/2013 Herceptin (trastuzumab) Targeted Therapy 9/14/2013 Afinitor (everolimus) Hormonal Therapy Arimidex (anastrozole) Hormonal Therapy Faslodex (fulvestrant) Hormonal Therapy Femara (letrozole) Hormonal Therapy Aromasin (exemestane) Hormonal Therapy Evista (raloxifene) Hormonal Therapy Targeted Therapy Avastin (bevacizumab) Surgery Lumpectomy: Right Surgery Mastectomy: Left, Right Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Chemoembilization? KasSha redwolf8812

Posts.Content: Nov 5, 2010 03:07PM KasSha wrote: I had one Ixempra treatment. My side effects were pretty bad. Then couple days later got my lab results and the Ixempra had brought my TM's down from 169 to 67! That is waaaay more than any other drug has done for me! I am sticking to my new chemo regimen for now but if it fails to work I will definitely look at Ixempra again,,,just maybe in smaller dose.  Good Luck to you-
Posts.Title: Ixempra actually work for anyone? PJB PJB

I now am trying to decide if I want to go ahead with the injection on wednesday for immediate relief since the radiation sometimes takes a few weeks.

Posts.Content: Apr 26, 2010 06:14AM KasSha wrote: Ladies, thanks for your input. Got my insurance approval and they are going to cover it....but with a hefty copay.  At this point I may put it off and see of he can give me stronger pain meds because I am having pain in mets to hips too and he said that meds would be best to address that issue.

Posts.Title: Pinched nerve treatments? KasSha Lowrider54

Posts.Content: KasSha wrote: I have a pinched nerve causing stinging, tingling, and then numbness down my right leg. Only happens a couple times a week usually when I have been on my feet awhile. Onc sent me to pain specialist. He says the source is probably mets in my lower spine. He gave me cortizone shot which did not work. Went for MRI Wednesday...dont have results yet but doc says will probably do some sort of injection for it depending on results. I was thinking quick shot in docs office...but then his office contacted me about preregistering at the surgicenter and then told me not to eat anything for 6 hours before the procedure. Not sure what he has planned for me but you can bet I will find out before I just walk in to the clinic for my "procedure" Anyone out there had issues with pinched nerves? What worked and didnt work for you? Posts.Content: Jan 21, 2010 04:00PM - edited Jan 21, 2010 04:01PM by KasSha I think this is a great idea. I've considered it myself but my situation probably wont allow it from what I m learning from evreyone's posts. My dr. tells me I could live for years..mets is extensive in my bones (sternum, ribs, spine, both hips, skull) but hasnt spread to what he calls "life-threatening organs". I have been having severe pain in my hips even tho they were radiated in September...I would like to take some insurance money and do something fun before I am confined to a wheelchair!
Posts.Title: Accelerated benefits - Have you considered withdrawing? JennGrace vickib

Posts.Content: Mar 25, 2014 12:08PM KasSha wrote: I'm not frequent visitor to this site but wanted to see if others are having the good results with Kadcyla that I am having. I started in December. My markers went down over 600 points after the first treatment and have continued to decrease! Scans last month showed liver looks clear and my bone mets show improvement!  The main side effects I've had are numbness in my toes, a low grade fever in the evenings for about 3 days after treatment, and some flu like symptoms day 4 and 5. But this is one of the most tolerable chemos I've been on and I've been on just about everything over my 18 year struggle. Glad to hear others are having good responses as well!
Posts.Title: Who's on Kadcyla/TDM1? Trish03 Denny123

Posts.Content: Mar 25, 2014 12:46PM KasSha wrote: Denise  I didn't read all the way down this thread until after I posted. So sorry to hear of your awful night last night.  It's strange that it occurred after you'd had a couple successful treatments. I hope your doc can pinpoint the problem soon.
Posts.Title: Who's on Kadcyla/TDM1? Trish03 Denny123

Posts.Content: Aug 10, 2010 11:39PM KasSha wrote: I have very similar bone mets. I am seeing a physical therapist. My back pain has decreased substantialy.  She has me walking every day and has incorporated both yoga and pilates in my exercises.  Since radiation on both my hips I have lost range of motion and cannot sit cross-legged. So, some of my exercises are modified. I go once a week with every other week in the pool...I love those days the most! It seems like I can move so much better in the water. Unfortunately, I dont have access to a pool the other days of the week. My husband joked that he would dig one in the backyard with his garden shovel ....but I declined his offer!! Hope you get some releif soon- KasSha
Posts.Title: Safe exercises for bone mets frankandfernsmom YogaLady
